Class Primer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.goprimer.Primer

extends Object

      • init

        public static void init(android.app.Application app,
                        PrimerOptions options)
        Initializes Primer. Pass in your Application object, and also your configured PrimerOptions
        Parameters:
        app - - the Application object
        options - - required options for configuring Primer

      • getInstallAttribution

        public static PrimerAttribution getInstallAttribution()
        Returns:
        Get the Install Attribution data. Return null if we don't have it yet.

      • getLatestAttribution

        public static PrimerAttribution getLatestAttribution()
        Returns:
        Get the latest Attribution data. Return null if we don't have it yet.

      • getTargetingLink

        public static void getTargetingLink(String targeting,
                                    @Nullable
                                    org.json.JSONObject additionalParams,
                                    TargetingLinkCallback targetingLinkCallback)
        Retrieves a Smart Link for the given targeting.
        Parameters:
        targeting - The key of the targeting to get the link for.
        additionalParams - The parameters to be attached to the link.
        targetingLinkCallback - The callback that gets called with the retrieved link, or with `null` if one cannot be retrieved.

      • appendUserProperties

        public static void appendUserProperties(@Nullable
                                        Map<String,String> userProperties)
        The SDK keeps track of properties attached to each user, and syncs this information with the Primer servers, so whenever you log a user in with the same unique user ID, the same properties you attached earlier will be present. User properties are also attached to all events that the current user triggers, and they can be used for dynamic variable replacements on Primer experience screens. If you'd like to append some properties to the current user, just pass in a Map filled with the keys and values.
        Parameters:
        userProperties - - Map of key/values that are appended to the current user

      • signupUser

        public static void signupUser(String userId)
        Whenever a user is signed up from outside of a Primer flow, then you should notify Primer so we can keep track of the user's state.
        Parameters:
        userId - - A unique identifier for this user

      • loginUser

        public static void loginUser(String userId)
        Whenever a user logs out from your system, use this method to let Primer know to untrack this user. If you don't call this, then the Primer screens will not be shown when the user enters the app again.
        Parameters:
        userId - - A unique identifier for this user

      • logout

        public static void logout()
        Whenever a user logs out from your system, use this method to let Primer know to stop tracking this user. If you don't call this, then the Primer screens will not be shown when the user enters the app again. Note: you are still in charge of recreating your desired next activity

      • trackEventWithName

        public static void trackEventWithName(@NonNull
                                      String name,
                                      @Nullable
                                      org.json.JSONObject additionalProperties)
        To accompany our automatic events, we let you track your own custom ones, so you can make them part of your analytical process in our Dashboard. There are no limitations on what you track, and no setup is necessary for new event names or parameters, just pass in a string for the name and a JSONObject of parameters, and they all get associated with the event.
        Parameters:
        name - - Event name to track
        additionalProperties - - JSONObject of additional parameters to track with this event

      • clearImageDiskCache

        public static boolean clearImageDiskCache(android.app.Application appContext)
        Primer will cache all images that were shown during the experience. This will clear the image cache on disk.

      • clearImageMemCache

        public static void clearImageMemCache(android.app.Application appContext)
        Primer will cache all images that were shown during the experience. This will clear the image cache currently living in memory.

      • getCurrentUser

        public static PrimerUser getCurrentUser()
        Returns current user We encourage holding only a local reference to the current user instance because on logout, login and other callbacks the SDK releases it and creates a new object, thus rendering any permanent reference outdated.
        Returns:
        current user

        private static void ensureInitialized()
